meanings.definition: Liked better or best; liked more
meanings.sent2: She always chooses her preferred brand of cereal.
meanings.sent3: The cat's preferred napping spot is on the sunny windowsill.
meanings.sent4: His preferred method of relaxation is listening to music.
meanings.sent5: The preferred candidate won the election by a large margin.

meanings.definition: To choose or want; to select as a preference
meanings.sent1: I preferred to stay home and read rather than go out.
meanings.sent2: They preferred the red velvet cake over the chocolate one.
meanings.sent3: The dog preferred to play fetch with the squeaky toy.
meanings.sent4: She preferred to take the scenic route to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent5: He preferred to finish his work before taking a break.

meanings.definition: To give priority or precedence to; to favor
meanings.sent1: The manager preferred to promote employees from within the company.
meanings.sent2: They preferred to allocate more resources to the project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher preferred to start the class with a fun activity.
meanings.sent4: She preferred to give her attention to the most urgent tasks first.
meanings.sent5: He preferred to support local businesses over big corporations.
